___pickup_time.description: defined time window when the carrier should pickup shipments

___phone.description: telephone number (mandatory when using UPS and the following terms apply: service is one_day or one_day_early or ship to country is different than ship from country)

___country.description: Country as uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code

___id.description: identifier of a previously created address

___pickup_address.description: address where the shipment should be picked up

___phone.description: telephone number (mandatory when using UPS and the following terms apply: service is one_day or one_day_early or ship to country is different than ship from country)

___country.description: Country as uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code

___id.description: identifier of a previously created address

___description.description: text that describes the contents of the package. This parameter is mandatory if you're using UPS with service returns or DHL with service express

___type.description: defines packages of being of a certain type - if no value is given, parcel will be used

___declared_value.description: describing the value of the package contents

___size.description: defines the DIN size that the returned label should have

___pickup_time.description: defined time window when the carrier should pickup shipments

___pickup_address.description: address where the shipment should be picked up

___name.description: key to identify the additional service

___language.description: language the customer should be notified in (ISO-639-1 format)

___reference1.description: Text that should be displayed as the reason for transfer

___reference_number.description: a reference number (max. 30 characters) that you want this shipment to be identified with. You can use this afterwards to easier find the shipment in the shipcloud.io backoffice

___size.description: defines the DIN size that the returned label should have

___service.description: The service that should be used for the shipment. standard: The standard (ground) service for each carrier. returns: Returns service. one_day: express delivery. one_day_early: express delivery until 10am.

___notification_email.description: email address that we should notify once there's an update for this shipment

___description.description: text that describes the contents of the shipment. This parameter is mandatory if you're using UPS and the following conditions are true: from and to countries are not the same; from and/or to countries are not in the EU; from and to countries are in the EU and the shipments service is not standard

___carrier.description: acronym of the carrier you want to use

___create_shipping_label.description: determines if a shipping label should be created at the carrier (this means you will be charged when using the production api key)

___description.description: text that describes the contents of the package. This parameter is mandatory if you're using UPS with service returns or DHL with service express

___type.description: defines packages of being of a certain type - if no value is given, parcel will be used

___declared_value.description: describing the value of the package contents

___phone.description: telephone number (mandatory when using UPS and the following terms apply: service is one_day or one_day_early or ship to country is different than ship from country)

___country.description: Country as uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code

___id.description: identifier of a previously created address

___phone.description: telephone number (mandatory when using UPS and the following terms apply: service is one_day or one_day_early or ship to country is different than ship from country)

___country.description: Country as uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code

___id.description: identifier of a previously created address

___from.description: If missing, the default sender address (if defined in your shipcloud account) will be used

___metadata.description: here you can save additional data that you want to be associated with the shipment. Any combination of key-value pairs is possible
